    • Method Detail

      • isValidMove

        public boolean isValidMove(int startRow,
                           int startCol,
                           int endRow,
                           int endCol,
                           ChessPiece[][] board)
        Pawn isValidMove does a few checks. If attempting to move two spaces forward(forward being towards the current players enemy start location), the function checks if the piece has previously moved. If it has not previously moved, it checks the locations in front of the pawn. If both squares are empty, and the desired location is two spots in front of the pawn, returns true Otherwise the function checks if the pawn is moving laterally at all for an attack. The pawn checks if an enemy exists in the diagonal direction, and if so returns true If there is no enemy, the function checks if there is a pawn directly next to the pawn being moved. It then checks if that pawn moved two spaces on the previous turn. If the pawn did indeed move two on the previous turn, the function treats it as if it is in the attackable diagonal direction, executing enpassant. Otherwise, check if the pawns desired location is the spot directly in front of it. If it is and the spot is free, return true Otherwise return false
        Specified by:
        isValidMove in class ChessPiece
        Parameters:
        startRow - startRow is the row of the piece being tested
        startCol - startCol is the column of the piece being tested
        endRow - endRow is the row of the space attempting to be moved to
        endCol - endCol is the column of the space attempting to be moved to
        board - board is the 8x8 chessboard housing all the pieces. This is passed to check for things such as friendly pieces being in the end location, or enemy pieces being in the path of the move.
        Returns:
        isValidMove returns true if the move is acceptable, or false if it breaks the rules

      • setMoveTwoTurn

        public void setMoveTwoTurn(int i)
        sets the pawns variable that tracks on what turn it moved two spaces. Used in checking if an enemy pawn can execute enpassant on this pawn
        Parameters:
        i - i is the turn on which the pawn moved two spaces

      • getTwoMoveTurn

        public int getTwoMoveTurn()
        getTwoMoveTurn returns the turn on which the pawn moved two spaces. Used in checking for valid enpassant
        Returns:
        returns the integer value of the turn that the pawn moved two spaces on

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        toString override for Pawn. Prints 'w' or 'b' depending on color, followed by a lowercase 'p'
        Overrides:
        toString in class ChessPiece
